section.note: Make sure that you use a clean operating system. This avoids compatibility-related issues during the installation.
section.p: As underlying platform technology, the following OpenStack platforms are supported:

ul.li: Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 10

section.p: The following hardware resources are recommended:

entry.p: At least 32 GB, 64 GB or more recommended.
At least 8 cores, 16 cores or more recommended.
HDD or SSD, SSD strongly recommended for productive operation and high performance.

section.p: without any data requires about 2 GB of disk space. The disk capacity required for log data and metrics data varies considerably depending on the number of services and servers to be monitored. For information on how to calculate the required disk space, refer to the section below.
The installation mounts a volume for the data directories of Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, MySQL, Kafka, and Grafana. The default installation uses the /opt/monasca-containers directory.

section.title: Calculating the Required Disk Space
section.p: As a basic rule of thumb, the following formula can be used for calculating the required disk space:
section.codeblock: 200 GB + [ <number of nodes> * <retention period> * (<space for log data/day> + <space for metrics data/day>) ]

li.p: The number of nodes corresponds to the number of nodes to be monitored.
The retention period corresponds to 60 days for InfluxDB and Elasticsearch.
The space for log data/day corresponds to approximately 2 GB.
The space for metrics data/day corresponds to approximately 50 MB.
